job_title: Streaming Software Development Engineer, Vision Products Software
job_description: • Minimum QualificationsBS/MS in CS/CE and/or equivalent with 3+ years of experienceAbility to understand end to end architectures and functional details of a complex system with multiple inter-dependenciesExperience working with audio visual mediaStrong software development experience in C / C++ for multi-threaded/systems developmentOutstanding analytical, programming and debugging skillsExcellent communication skills, ability to collaborate and deliver under aggressive schedules.

• Minimum QualificationsMaster's degree or foreign equivalent in Computer Science or a related field and 3 years of work experience in the job offered or related occupation.
• 3 years of experience with each of the following skills is required:Using Linux shell Scripts to improve deployment infrastructure and processing.
• Using Load Balancers, DNS, Nginx to ensure reliable traffic routing, fast failover, and prevention of silent outages across distributed systemsUsing SQL (e.
• Oracle, Postgres), NoSQL datastore (e.
• Couchbase, Cassandra), messaging (e.
• Kafka, RabbitMQ) and search technologies (e.
• Solr, Elastic Search).
• Managing Configuration management using Ansible, Jenkins, and Git.

• Minimum QualificationsBachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent in Computer Science, Cognitive Science or related fieldExperience and/or education must include:Utilizing relational (SQL) and non-relational databases to design and optimize data schemas for distributed systemsUtilizing object-oriented and functional languages (Java, Python) to design and develop multi-language codebasesUtilizing JavaScript and ReactJS to implement real-time collaboration features for webTranslating design requirements into functional specificationsUtilizing test-driven development (TDD) to drive code implementation through continuous testingUtilizing Jenkins for continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) to automate build, test, and deployment processesUtilizing GitHub for source code management.

• Minimum QualificationsBS in Computer Science/Computer Engineering or equivalent experience/skillsAt least 4 years of relevant experienceIn-depth knowledge of C/C++Strong knowledge of operating systems fundamentals and embedded systemsExperience in developing kernel drivers, embedded firmware, system frameworks, etc.
• Strong analytical and debugging skillsStrong communication and collaboration skills.

• Minimum QualificationsBachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent in Computer Science or related field.
• Experience and/or education must include:Performing Application and User Interface development using Swift, SwiftUI, and Objective-CUtilizing multi-threaded programming and concurrency frameworks for distributed and asychronous workloadsUtilizing cross-process communication, notify/observer design patterns, and process/data sandboxing strategies to facilitate system-level feature developmentUtilizing spatial rendering concepts for AR/VR applicationsUtilizing Continuous Integration and Development pipelines to deliver shipping softwareTranslating design requirements into functional specifications across multiple teams and dependent componentsDebugging and triaging using interactive debuggers, system logs, and crash report analysisProviding concise updates to varying levels of corporate engineering and leadership.

• Your role will involve collaborating with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and implement software applications that meet the needs of our customers.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to meet software engineering requirements.
• In this role, you will play a key part in defining software requirements, designing embedded solutions, and verifying system performance, ensuring our maintenance systems meet the evolving needs of modern aircraft.
• The ideal candidate will bring hands‑on experience with system‑level testing, REST APIs, structured data formats, and embedded or IoT platforms to ensure the reliability, performance, and compliance of technologies deployed across mission‑critical environments worldwide.
• You’ll bridge engineering and IT to ensure complex aerospace development ecosystems perform at scale, meet rigorous standards, and align with regulatory and export‑controlled requirements.
• This position is ideal for engineers experienced in modern software development methodologies, debugging, and performance optimization, who thrive in highly technical, cross‑functional environments.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to meet software engineering requirements You will report directly to our Senior Engineering Manager and you will work out of our Phoenix, AZ location on a Hybrid work schedule.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to meet software engineering requirements.
